Summary: Red/White Pulsating Fireball over Northern Bakersfield
trends: There have been 32 other sightings in Bakersfield
There were no other sightings in Bakersfield on or around July 4th 2013
divs: sighting detailsi was standing on the balcony, which faces north. i was on the phone with a friend of mine and had just stepped outside to have a cigarette while we talked. it was july 4, so i had been scanning the horizon all night, looking over the city for fireworks, etc. over the building across the street to the north of ours, i noted a bright red point of light. it initially reminded me of a firework mortar that glows brightly as it flies into the air, and then disappears, usually just before exploding into a dazzling array. this however, was moving eastward in the sky, at a slight upward angle. it was glowing red, bright and intense. as i tried to focus and pay attention to the detail, it seemed to be obscured by smoke or some form of vapor. a secondary thought was that it was akin to seeing a rocket launch or afterburner takeoff, with a smoke\vapor trail, however, being night time, i could see no trail, only the illuminated cloud near the bright light. as i watched, a white light would pulsate from the object as well, or perhaps it was changing color between red and white, back and forth. but it was a pulse type color change, the each color was just as bright, and there was no discernible pattern of timing. i attempted to use another cell phone to get video, but it was distant enough that i could not get a good view of it. before it was to move out of my view, when it was just north, of northeast, it began a noticeable arc downward and faded out of sight. there were no other witnesses that i am aware of.
